p: Thus, a carbon price applied initially to the G20 economies can generate adequate and predictable money for building a low carbon climate-resilient world. To ensure equity, there can be a differentiated application among countries, what Caney (2010) calls “poverty-sensitive” PPP. Actually, carbon taxes can be paired with “carbon dividends” for the poor. The development agencies led by the World Bank, issue networks, businesses, and CSOs/NGOs have growing clout in the discourse on carbon pricing. Now, the consent of Japan and the new US administration may help realize the additionality in climate finance. Upon its acceptance, institutional mechanisms can be further negotiated.
